definition: to learn on the job/to be on probation
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Cpl. Erica LI and LCpl. Mandy TSE leaded the congregation to sing.
sentences.chinese: 李樂樺小隊長及謝敏德見習小隊長帶領會衆唱歌。

sentences.english: The position of trainee is much the same as that of an intern in a hospital.
sentences.chinese: 見習員的地位和醫院裏的實習醫生很相似。

sentences.english: I took on Phillip as my trainee.
sentences.chinese: 我同意讓菲利浦做我的見習生。

sentences.english: A residency is general ly between 3 and 7 years.
sentences.chinese: 一個見習期一般需要3到7年時間。

sentences.english: Next, he wished to see a little of the working of a flourmill.
sentences.chinese: 還有一層，他想多少見習見習麪粉廠的情況。

sentences.english: Next, he wished to see a little of the working of a flourmill.
sentences.chinese: 還有一層，他想多少見習見習麪粉廠的情況。

sentences.english: After I graduated medical school, I worked as an intern in an emergency room.
sentences.chinese: 從醫學院畢業後，我在急診室做見習醫生。

sentences.english: The period of being a novice.
sentences.chinese: 就是他這九個月的見習期。

sentences.english: Provides information about the Youth Pre-employment Training Programme and the Youth Work Experience and Training Scheme.
sentences.chinese: 提供有關展翅計劃及青少年見習就業計劃的信息。

sentences.english: Is there any discount if it is done by a trainee?
sentences.chinese: 要是一個見習生剪我發，可以打折嗎？

sentences.english: No freelance or apprentice jockey allowance may be claimed.
sentences.chinese: 自由身騎師及見習騎師將不獲減磅。
我已經得到了一些見習。

sentences.english: It was then made compulsory for doctors from over-seas to sit by Nellie for a month.
sentences.chinese: 那時硬性規定國外來的醫生都要見習一個月。

sentences.english: Hi-tech companies need many interns to work for them during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 高科技公司在夏天需要許多見習生爲其工作。

sentences.english: Phil was articled to a firm of lawyers.
sentences.chinese: 菲爾簽約在一家律師事務所當見習生。

sentences.english: Apprentice jockey Willy Kan Wai-yue was killed in a fall at Sha Tin racecourse yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 見習騎師簡慧榆於昨日在沙田馬場墮馬喪生。

definition: to draw up the theme (for discussion)
guide (e.g. book or other printed material)
to attend school as a day student
person in charge of a place that ends in 園|园, such as a vineyard 葡萄園|葡萄园, zoo 動物園|动物园, cemetery 陵園|陵园 etc
